intro: Trias elongata, commonly known as the slender trias, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its elongated, slender stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of its family. Trias elongata thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in plant morphology and ecology.
